The file could not be created because of one of the following reasons:

Found two problems:

1. Can not create a new file in an empty directory using dstore on Windows. The log is attached.

2. I could not browse "root" drives, C:\, D:\, etc. Expanding My Home filter works, and I can browse directories in that filter.

I think this is a duplicate of 162781.  With my dev driver I extracted the fix for it and I don't see this problem.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 162781 ***

I can create a new file in a directory using dstore on Windows, but the nodes seem to collapse all the way to the filter.

For example, I drill down Drives -> D: -> Test -> Empty. Right click on Empty and create a new file. The nodes collapse and only the filter "Drives" is expanded showing the drives on the system.

I'm lowering the priority from P1 to P2, since it's not as serious as before, but nonetheless it's annoying.
Kushal can you take a look at this filter collapsing problem?  I think it has to do with the fact that the "Drives" filter is "*".
This problem is actually occurring with non-Windows platforms as well.

Fixed bug for Windows. It was because we were always getting a match for the "Drives" filter which has the filter string "*", and this filter was therefore always being refreshed. This is a rather serious bug because RSE would end up doing refresh unnecessarily.

We have the same problem with the "My Home" filter on Linux/Unix systems, due to the fix for bug 160186.
Fixed the problem with "My Home" as well, in the process fixing another problem. This is documented in bug 160186.
